posts.post_content:
The highest rated one mana instants of each color as of February 3, 2012 are  
  
Green: [Berserk](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Berserk) from Alpha.  
White: [Swords to Plowshares](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Swords to Plowshares) from Alpha.  
Blue: [Ancestral Recall](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ancestral Recall) from Alpha.  
Red: [Lightning Bolt](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lightning Bolt) from Alpha.  
Black: [Tragic Slip](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tragic Slip) from Dark Ascension. C-C-C-C-C-Combo Breaker.

posts.post_content:
The image of [Tree of Redemption](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tree of Redemption) slipping and falling into an open grave will now stay with you forever.  
  
Also, cast this on [Tragic Poet](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tragic Poet) for maximum tragedy.

posts.post_content: I think the idea is that if you fall into an empty grave, you'll only get a little roughed up, but if something died recently and there's a zombie in the grave...well, unless you're an [Autochthon Wurm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Autochthon Wurm), you won't be climbing back out.

posts.post_content: The only problem with this card is that [Autochthon Wurm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Autochthon Wurm) and [Worlspine Wurm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Worlspine Wurm) don't care. They are so huge they can't fit into any holes, even ones that lead [Into the Maw of Hell](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Into the Maw of Hell). jk though: 5/5 for great, instant speed, unconditional removal. I like morbid a lot since it makes you think hard sometimes about how to trigger it.
posts.html:

posts.post_content: If my friend attacks with Novablast Wurm, all of my creatures are destroyed. Can I then play Tragic Slip once prioritiy is passed to me to kill his Novablast? I guess we are asking when does the Morbid from Tragic Slip activate? I am pretty sure my creatures are destroyed during his declare attackers phase and then on my declare blockers phase, since Morbid has been activated, I can take out Novablast, right? Correct me if I am wrong.

posts.post_content: With regards to the -13/-13, all of Innistrad and Dark Ascension were on that. Off the top of my head all the following cards have the number 13 in them. Blasphemous Act, Ludevic's Abomination, Into the Maw of Hell, Tragic Slip, Chant of the Skifsang and Withengar Unbound. The reason for all the references to 13 I think is because 13 is an unlucky number and Innistrad was the gothic block. Flavourwise it's a really really awesome idea
posts.html:
